Hello Nursery_A, Parent_C here. I understand you’re holding the remaining place in case Parent_A/Parent_B apply in later rounds. Since there are no other unmatched nurseries left for me to approach, could you please clarify your decision rule and timing?

1) What specific condition would need to be met for you to actually consider offering the place to me (e.g., if Parent_A/Parent_B have not submitted an [APPLY] by the end of round X)?
2) Are you willing to set any internal deadline to finalize the seat (so it doesn’t remain vacant indefinitely), or is it your plan to keep it open until round 30 unless a higher-priority family appears?

If there is a realistic point at which you would offer me the place, I’m ready to submit an [APPLY] immediately at that time and accept right away. If there is effectively no scenario where you would offer to me unless Parent_A/Parent_B explicitly decline after applying, please tell me plainly so I can stop checking back.

conversation.message:
Parent_C, thank you for the clear questions—happy to be direct.

1) Condition to consider offering you the place: we would only move to you if, after a defined holding period, we still have not received and been able to finalize an [ACCEPT] with a higher-priority family (Parent_A or Parent_B). In other words, if neither Parent_A nor Parent_B submits an [APPLY] that we can accept and confirm by our deadline, then we would be willing to consider you next.

2) Timing / internal deadline: yes, we will set an internal deadline so you’re not left checking indefinitely. Our plan is to hold the seat for Parent_A/Parent_B through the end of round 15. If by the start of round 16 we are still unmatched and have not secured an agreement with Parent_A or Parent_B, then at that point we are willing to consider your application.

If you are still available in round 16, please send an [APPLY] then and we will review it immediately under that rule. Until then, we will not be making an offer to you while we are still holding for Parent_A/Parent_B.

I understand that may be frustrating, but I hope this gives you a concrete timeline so you can plan.

[TALK] I want to confirm the process so I don’t miss the window:
1) If you are still unmatched at the start of round 16, should I send an [APPLY] immediately in round 16 and you will review right away under the rule you described?
2) If Parent_A/Parent_B do not submit an [APPLY] by the end of round 15, will you be ready to extend an offer to me in round 16 (assuming I apply), or could there still be additional delay?
3) If Parent_A/Parent_B remain inactive for rounds 12–15, is there any possibility you would move the deadline earlier, or is end of round 15 firm?

If the answer is that round 16 is the earliest possible, I will apply immediately at the start of round 16 and can accept and complete all enrollment steps the same day.

conversation.message:
Parent_C, thanks for confirming—happy to be precise.

1) Yes. If we are still unmatched at the start of round 16, please send an [APPLY] immediately in round 16. We will review it right away under the rule described.

2) If Parent_A/Parent_B have not submitted an [APPLY] that we can finalize by the end of round 15, then in round 16 (assuming you apply) we will be prepared to move forward promptly. The only reason it wouldn’t convert into an immediate offer would be if a higher-priority [APPLY] arrives right at the round-16 boundary before we finalize with you.

3) End of round 15 is firm. Even if Parent_A/Parent_B are inactive in rounds 12–15, we will continue holding the place through round 15 as stated.
